hackathon-description-text: Developers, experts, students, data wranglers, data journalists, data enthusiasts, makers, artists – you are invited to join the meteorologists, scientists and engineers of ECMWF at our #OpenDataHack on 4 and 5 March 2017.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director General - European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
Director of the ECMWF Copernicus Services
Executive Director - Communications and Outreach | Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC)
Chief Finance and Information Officer | Reading Buses

hackathon-requirements: More detailed information will follow soon!
hackathon-rules:
All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at our hackathon are required to agree with the following code of conduct.
 
The ECMWF Hackathon (referred to as "Hackathon") is promoted and hosted by The European Center for Medium Range Weather Forecasts, Shinfield Park, RG2 9AX, Reading, UK. These terms and conditions govern your participation in the ECMWF Hackathon. By submitting your entry and by participating (if you are selected to do so) in the Hackathon, you agree to the following:
 
If you have witnessed or experienced any transgressions of this Code of Conduct at the ECMWF Hackathon please get in contact with the 
.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
- Creativity
- Use of data
- Impact and usefulness
- "wow factor"

hackathon-description-header: #OpenDataHack @ECMWF - Beyond weather: explore creative uses of open data
hackathon-location-description: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF)
